plants.name: ZZ Plant
plants.essential-2: Does best in room temp (60 - 70  F)
plants.essential-3: Grows best in bright filtered light
plants.essential-4: Allow solid to become dry to touch between watering days
plants.whatNotToDo-2: Does not do well in cold temp (45 F and below)
plants.whatNotToDo-4: Avoid over watering! This plant does better with less water

schedules.note: (One cup of water ever two - three weeks)

plants.name: Bell Pepper
plants.essential-2: Peppers need a lot of sunlight in order in order to produce healthy fruit
plants.essential-3: Start your pepper seeds indoors 8 - 10 weeks before spring in order to prevent your plant from the winter frosty months
plants.essential-4: Needs 1 - 2 inches of water per week
plants.whatNotToDo-2: Do not keep your plant seedlings outside. Peppers seeds need warmth in order to germinate or grow properly
plants.whatNotToDo-3: Do not keep your pepper in the shade, it loves lots of sunlight
plants.whatNotToDo-4: Do not transplant your bell pepper until you are sure the frosty season is over. Bell peppers must be in tempuratures above 50 degrees F once outdoors

plants.name: Lemon Tree
plants.essential-2: Water one twice a week before you begin to see new growth (at least 1 inch of water). After growth your tree is settled in and growing, begin deep watering every 10 days
plants.essential-3: Ensure your lemon tree is in a sunny spot and has at least 10 ft of space around it
plants.essential-4: Once lemons are yellow in color and 2 - 3 inches in size, the fruit is ready to be picked
plants.whatNotToDo-2: Do not plant your lemon tree very close to walls and other large trees
plants.whatNotToDo-3: DO not plant your lemon tree in a cool shady area. Citrus plants enjoy the sun
plants.whatNotToDo-4: Do not wait till winter months (or frost season) to harvest fruit. The cold tempuratures will ruin the fruit

DB.name: Bell Pepper
DB.essential-2: Need a lot of sunlight in order in order to produce healthy fruit
DB.essential-3: Start your pepper seeds indoors 8 - 10 weeks before spring in order to prevent your plant from the winter frosty months
DB.essential-4: Needs 1 - 2 inches of water per week

DB.name: Aloe Vera
DB.essential-3: Make sure to choose a pot that has drainage holes and is as wide as it is deep
DB.whatNotToDo-2: Do not leave your aloe plant outside if it will be below 55 degrees
DB.whatNotToDo-4: Do not fertilize more than once a month

DB.name: Birds of Paradise
DB.essential-2: Does best in warm, tropical tempuratures
DB.essential-3: Grows best in bright light, so keep your plant in a sunny area
DB.essential-4: Allow solid to become dry to touch between watering days
DB.whatNotToDo-2: Does not do well in cold temp
DB.whatNotToDo-4: Avoid over watering! This plant does better with less water

DB.name: Jade Plant
DB.essential-2: Need a lot of sunlight in order in order to produce healthy fruit
DB.essential-3: Start your plant indoors 8 - 10 weeks before spring in order to prevent your plant from the winter frosty months
DB.essential-4: Needs at least 1 inch of water every other week
DB.whatNotToDo-2: Do not keep your plant outside
DB.whatNotToDo-3: Do not keep your plant in the shade, it loves lots of sunlight
DB.whatNotToDo-4: Do not transplant your bell pepper until you are sure the frosty season is over. Bell peppers must be in tempuratures above 50 degrees F once outdoors
